pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:0.5: 36. The training rule on covering with rice
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were covering their curries with rice because they wanted more. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.3.1: “‘I will not cover my curries with rice because I want more,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.4: One should not cover one’s curries with rice because one wants more.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, covers his curries with rice because he wants more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.10: if the owners cover it and then give;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.11: if it is not out of a desire for more;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk36:1.15: The sixth training rule is finished.
